ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: Great way to fulfill a preindustrial credit. Prof. Dal Prete tries to challenge the traditional Western-centric narrative of science and bring marginalized groups into the conversation. The weekly field trips are a great change from normal lectures and you get to see some really cool things.
I gained a deeper appreciation for the nuances of the scientific revolution and learned a lot about the makings of scientific knowledge during the early modern period.
You'll learn a lot about the intersection of the church and scientific thought in medieval times.
I developed the ability to further analyze primary sources and develop a clear thesis.
Strong writing and history emphasis
The course reshaped my perspective on the Scientific Revolution and scientific progress more generally.
learned about history and misconceptions about scientific revolution, had the opportunity to be hands on with archival materials

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: Strengths: professor, TA, lecture schedule. I really enjoyed the every-other-lecture field trips where we got to engage with primary sources from libraries around Yale. Yale has a great inventory of these items!

Strengths: The opportunity to go to either the Beinecke or Medical Historical Library every week was truly amazing. It was so exciting to get to hold and learn from tangible pieces of history, and it really gave the lessons weight. Professor Dal Prete is a very passionate professor and lecturer, which really made the course content shine. 

Weaknesses: The structure of this class meant that the experience was heavily influenced by our TA, who in this case, was very weak. The discussion sections did not really add much to my understanding of or engagement with the material. A well facilitated discussion in section could have done wonders, but unfortunately, they very rarely occurred.
If you want to gain a comprehensive understanding of the Scientific Revolution and its implications you should definitely take this class!
While each individual lesson was interesting, it was difficult to trace a clear through line and understand the main takeaways from each lesson.
The weekly responses got a bit redundant and repetitive, especially because the prompts didnt really prompt much, but it was really cool material to learn about

The course had a lot of very interesting lectures, discussion sections, and library trips. It was also a good balance between interesting details and broader themes. Sometimes it felt like certain library visits were not essential to understanding material
all strengths, Professor Dal Prete and Emily did a great job of making it accessible and engaging. Its a fair workload with lots of opportunities to do well.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Yes, it's an interesting and not too stressful class.

Yes, it is an absolutely must take course if one wants to understand the roots of science and the modern world. This course also clears up many misconceptionsone major one in particular being the historical relationship between religion and science.

You also get to go on cool field trips to the beinecke and other library collections every week, its really amazing.

I would definitely recommend this course to another student, but really pay attention to who the TA is. If the structure of the class stays the same, they will be grading everything and they will be your main point of contact, so if they arent good, it will hurt your experience in the class (which it did for me, unfortunately).
I definitely would! This course offers a comprehensive understanding of the Scientific Revolution through analysis of several different events, artifacts, theories, and concepts.
For the sheer ability to interact with and learn about the materials that we did, yes.
Yes, I was excited for this course but did not expect to it as interesting as I did. The professor and TA worked very hard for the students and provided us with a lot of interesting material.
yes, it is well taught and geared toward you doing well if you do the assignments
